page.title: 14The Hurst Jnr. Sch. Fete
page.content:
By N.Earle/A.Munson/S.Jones
On Saturday 15th June 1985 Hurst Junior School had their annual summer fete. There were lots of different stalls. In the middle of the arena, there was dancing. I had two goes on 'Bonk a Gonk' a game in which you have to throw a ball to displace articles on a wall. The 3rd years had to do three dances; "Wish me luck", "Kiss me good night" and "We'll meet again". They also had stalls selling plants. Joanna did a competition to choose names for two dogs. After that Mr. Whatley did the raffle which had six prizes. The 1st a colour T.V., 2nd a lounger. The 3rd prize was a camera, 4th coffee maker. The 5th prize was a stereo music centre and the last was a food hamper. All together we raised over Â£1000 for our school.
